text: Not sure what to title this  Psychosomatic symptoms of suicidal thoughts Not really sure if this kinda post is really what this subreddit s for but if it doesn t belong  mods feel free to remove   m here  depressed as long as I can remember even if I didn t recognize it  first suicide attempt was at   recently went through some shit with a romantic partner and it dragged all those feelings I felt throughout high school to front and center in my mind   Now whenever I have suicidal thoughts I feel a literal pressure on the sides  or maybe kinda inside my head  almost directly above the ear  flap  I ve recently started getting actual professional help  so I m not really looking for  don t do it  massages or anything  just kinda wondering if this something others have had experience with   Also anyone else struggle with not realizing depression and suicidal thoughts aren t normal  I ve had to stop myself from talking about it with coworkers and such  It s just kinda been a part of me so long I don t realize it s a heavy topic  I m not trying to get locked up or cry for help  I have plenty of healthy and unhealthy coping mechanisms techniques I ve gathered over the years  and I have a great support structure  even if its severely weakened now that I don t have my ex around   It s just  normal to me  It s normal to be standing at my job I like with my coworker who s funny and understanding and just think  things would be better for myself and everyone around me if I dropped dead right now   I m kinda tired of feeling this way and that s why I ve gotten help for it  I guess I m looking for anyone else who is having similar discomforts   end  am depression exposition

text: I tried  but I just don t belong here This world is just not made for me  I m the shy loner in the corner who sits and observes the rest of the world  I ve never  ever wanted to be a part of it  I m a  s kid and my generation honestly embarrasses me with its self obsession and greed  I figure my behaviour is mostly because my father abandoned me before I was born and my mother didn t even want me in the first place  I really don t want to kill myself  but I feel I have no choice I did try though  Within the last two years  in no particular order  I ve managed to get a job after   months of unemployment  graduated from university with a first class honours degree  went from obese to normal BMI with a diet and exercise regime  joined social clubs and made friends  travelled independently  learned a new language  I even improved basic things like personal hygiene  All of those things brought temporary joy but ultimately resulted in me feeling even more distant to everyone and everything else than I had even imagined before  What more is there even left to try There is absolutely nothing keeping me tied to this earth anymore  Even my hobbies no longer interest me  Waking up and dragging myself around everyday is crippling  I only wrote this in case anyone else feels the same  Surely I m not the only one  One day I will find the courage to finally end the misery
summary: In the last two years he has managed to get a job, graduated from university with a first class honours degree, went from obese to normal BMI with diet and exercise regime, joined social clubs, travelled independently, learned a new language and improved basic things like personal hygiene, but he still feels distant from everyone.
cleaned: year manage job graduate university class honours degree go obese normal ami diet exercise regime join social club travel independently learn new language improve basic thing like personal hygiene feel distant

text: Why is suicide not allowed In some countries  suicide is considered a crime  but I am talking about developed countries here   Why is suicide not permitted   It s enforced as if it were a crime  but not punished to the same extent   Just a bit of context here I guess   I have attempted at my life multiple times before   I ve been in the hospital three times  twice on the psychiatric ward  for suicidal ideations or attempts   After my first hospitalization for   weeks  I was sent to a youth custody facility   Sentenced there by a judge until youth protection deemed it to be okay for me to leave   I get that they are trying to protect people  but the conditions there are horrible   I just don t get why they are trying to protect people from themselves   What s so wrong about ending one s life   Why do we have freedom if we can t fully decide our own fate   I know that if I were to commit suicide that it would greatly affect my family  but sometimes I just don t care   I just want to end my own suffering   And just because of that  authorities put me into facilities that cause me even more suffering   I just don t understand how this cycle is supposed to make any sense   What do we owe to anyone that we have to stay alive
summary: Suicide is a crime in developed countries but not punished to the same extent as a crime. He has tried to kill himself several times before and has been in the hospital three times twice on the psychiatric ward for suicidal ideations or attempts. After his first hospitalization for weeks he was sent to a youth custody facility. He was there by a judge until youth protection deemed it to be okay for him to leave.
cleaned: suicide crime develop country not punish extent crime try kill time hospital time twice psychiatric ward suicidal ideation attempt hospitalization week send youth custody facility judge youth protection deem okay leave
